009package imagingbook.common.color;
010
011import java.awt.Color;
012
013import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
014
015/**
016 * This class defines static methods for manipulating and converting RGB colors.
017 * @author WB
018 *
019 */
020public abstract class RgbUtils {
021        
022        private RgbUtils() {}
023        
024        /** ITU BR.601 weights for RGB to Y (luma) conversion. */
025        public static final double[] ITU601RgbWeights = {0.299, 0.587, 0.114}; 
026        
027        /** ITU BR.709 weights for RGB to Y (luma) conversion. */
028        public static final double[] ITU709RgbWeights = {0.2126, 0.7152, 0.0722}; 
029        
030        public static double[] getDefaultWeights() {
031                return ITU709RgbWeights.clone();
032        }
033
034        /**
035         * Converts the given integer-encoded 8-bit RGB color
036         * to a 3-element {@code int[]} with components red, green and blue.
037         * 
038         * @param argb integer-encoded 8-bit RGB color in ARGB format
039         * @return {@code int[]} with R, G, B components
040         */
041        public static int[] intToRgb(int argb) {
042                int[] RGB = new int[3];
043                decodeIntToRgb(argb, RGB);
044                return RGB;
045        }
046        
047        /**
048         * Converts the given integer-encoded 8-bit RGB color to a 3-element
049         * {@code int[]} with components red, green and blue. Fills the specified
050         * {@code int[]}, nothing is returned.
051         * 
052         * @param argb integer-encoded 8-bit RGB color in ARGB format
053         * @param RGB  {@code int[]} with R, G, B components
054         */
055        public static void decodeIntToRgb(int argb, int[] RGB) {
056                RGB[0] = ((argb >> 16) & 0xFF);
057                RGB[1] = ((argb >> 8) & 0xFF);
058                RGB[2] = (argb & 0xFF);
059        }
060
061        /**
062         * Encodes the given RGB component values into a single 32-bit {@code int} value
063         * in ARGB format (with transparency A set to zero).
064         * 
065         * @param RGB {@code int[]} with R, G, B components
066         * @return integer-encoded 8-bit RGB color in ARGB format
067         */
068        public static int encodeRgbToInt(int[] RGB) {
069                return encodeRgbToInt(RGB[0], RGB[1], RGB[2]);
070        }
071        
072        /**
073         * Encodes the given r, g, b component values into a single 32-bit {@code int}
074         * value in ARGB format (with transparency A set to zero).
075         * 
076         * @param r red component value
077         * @param g breen component value
078         * @param b blue component value
079         * @return integer-encoded 8-bit RGB color in ARGB format
080         */
081        public static int encodeRgbToInt(int r, int g, int b) {
082                return ((r & 0xff)<<16) | ((g & 0xff)<<8) | b & 0xff;
083        }
084        
085        // -------------------------------------------------------------
086        
087        /**
088         * Converts integer RGB values (with components assumed to be in [0,255])
089         * to float values in [0,1].
090         * 
091         * @param RGB a sequence of R,G,B values or {@code int[]}
092         * @return the RGB values normalized to [0,1]
093         */
094        public static float[] normalize(int[] RGB) {
095                return new float[] {RGB[0]/255f, RGB[1]/255f, RGB[2]/255f};
096        }
097        
098        public static double[] normalizeD(int[] RGB) {
099                return new double[] {RGB[0]/255.0, RGB[1]/255.0, RGB[2]/255.0};
100        }
101        
102        /**
103         * Converts float RGB values (with components assumed to be in [0,1]) to integer
104         * values in [0,255].
105         * 
106         * @param rgb RGB float values in [0,1]
107         * @return RGB integer values in [0,255]
108         */
109        public static int[] denormalize(float[] rgb) {
110                int[] RGB = new int[3];
111                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {                   
112                        RGB[i] = Math.round(rgb[i] * 255f);
113                        if (RGB[i] < 0)
114                                RGB[i] = 0;
115                        else if (RGB[i] > 255)
116                                RGB[i] = 255;
117                }
118                return RGB;
119        }
120        
121        /**
122         * Converts double RGB values (with components assumed to be in [0,1]) to
123         * integer values in [0,255].
124         * 
125         * @param rgb RGB float values in [0,1]
126         * @return RGB integer values in [0,255]
127         */
128        public static int[] denormalizeD(double[] rgb) {
129                int[] RGB = new int[3];
130                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {                   
131                        RGB[i] = (int) Math.round(rgb[i] * 255);
132                        if (RGB[i] < 0)
133                                RGB[i] = 0;
134                        else if (RGB[i] > 255)
135                                RGB[i] = 255;
136                }
137                return RGB;
138        }
139                
140        // -------------------------------------------------------------
141
142        /**
143         * Interpolates linearly between two specified colors.
144         * 
145         * @param ca first color (to be interpolated from)
146         * @param cb second color (to be interpolated to)
147         * @param t interpolation coefficient, must be in [0,1]
148         * @return the interpolated color
149         */
150        public static Color interpolate(Color ca, Color cb, double t) {
151                if (t < 0 || t > 1) {
152                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("interpolation coefficient must be in [0,1] but is " + t);
153                }
154                float[] a = ca.getRGBColorComponents(null);
155                float[] b = cb.getRGBColorComponents(null);
156                float[] c = Matrix.lerp(a, b, (float) t);
157                return new Color(c[0], c[1], c[2]);
158        }
159
160        /**
161         * Interpolates linearly between the colors in the specified color palette. The
162         * interpolation coefficient must be in [0,1]. If 0, the first palette color is
163         * returned, if 1 the last color.
164         * 
165         * @param palette an array of colors (at least 2)
166         * @param t       interpolation coefficient, must be in [0,1]
167         * @return the interpolated color
168         */
169        public static Color interpolate(Color[] palette, double t) {
170                if (palette.length < 2) {
171                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("length of color palette must be at least 2 but is " + palette.length);
172                }
173                if (t < 0 || t > 1) {
174                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("interpolation coefficient must be in [0,1] but is " + t);
175                }
176                final int n = palette.length;
177                double x = t * (n - 1);                 // x = 0,...,n-1 (float palette index)
178                int lo = (int) Math.floor(x);   // lower palette color index
179                int hi = (int) Math.ceil(x);    // upper palette color index
180                return interpolate(palette[lo], palette[hi], x - lo);
181        }
182
183}
